title: 108_s358
content: Credit for producing fuel from landfill gas is provided in Section 1. Extension and modification for facilities producing qualified fuels from landfill gas under Section 29 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Applies to facilities producing fuel from landfill gas placed in service between June 30, 1998, and January 1, 2008, for a 5-year period. For landfill gas facilities required to install gas collection systems, a tax credit substitution of $2 for $3 is applicable during the installation period. Special rules limit the amount of qualified fuels sold annually for credit purposes. The tax credit for landfill gas facilities is adjusted to $2 for $3 during the installation period. Special rules apply to limit the amount of qualified fuels sold annually for credit purposes. The facility's production capacity is capped at an average of 200,000 cubic feet of natural gas per day. The tax credit for landfill gas facilities is adjusted to $2 for $3 during the installation period. Qualified fuel from landfill gas includes all gas collection equipment installed as part of the facility over its lifespan. The amendments made by this section apply to fuel sold after the enactment of this Act. Extension and expansion of credit for production of electricity to include production from landfill gas. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 includes adding landfill gas as a qualified energy resource and defining a landfill gas facility as a qualified facility for tax credits. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to reduce credits for certain preeffective date facilities. This includes substituting 1.0 cents for 1.5 cents and shortening the 10-year period to a 5-year period for facilities placed in service before the enactment date. Coordination with section 29 is also addressed. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to reduce credits for certain facilities. Coordination with section 29 is addressed, stating that the term 'qualified facility' does not include facilities that have received credits under section 29. Additionally, the definition of 'landfill gas' is provided as gas derived from the biodegradation of municipal solid waste. These amendments apply to electricity sold after the enactment date of the Act.
